message.content: Oenothera curtiflora is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to the central United States. The plant has a hairy, erect stem that grows up to 2 feet tall. The leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and toothed. The flowers are bright yellow and have four petals that form a cross-like shape. The fruit is a capsule containing many small seeds. Oenothera curtiflora is commonly found in prairies, fields, and disturbed areas, often growing in large colonies. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
